page.title: 16PUBLIC HOUSES
page.content: The Fox and Hounds is in Charlton Adam ,It was built in the 16th century.It is now 385 years old.It is a free house.There is a family room where children may go and there are playthings for children in the garden. They also sell meals.There used to be a skittle alley. The Grey Hound is in Charlton Mackrell.It was first licensed in 1837.Before that date it served as a beer shop.There is an 'off-licence' where drinks may be bought to be consumed off the premises.No set meals are available,just crisps,nuts,etc. The pub has a car park and a garden where children may go. Several houses in the village were beer shops at one time.One such is 'George Cottage'which was the George and which gave its name to the street in which it stands.
